meanings.definition: Lack of ability to express oneself clearly or effectively.
meanings.sent1: Her inarticulacies in public speaking often made her nervous.
meanings.sent2: The professor's inarticulacies during the lecture confused the students.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inarticulacies, he managed to convey his emotions through music.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulacies of the broken piano keys created a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The inarticulacies of the artist's brushstrokes left the painting incomplete.

meanings.definition: Instances of being unable to communicate clearly or coherently.
meanings.sent1: The inarticulacies in the report led to misunderstandings among the team.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with inarticulacies in her speech when nervous.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the inarticulacies of a newscaster.
meanings.sent4: The inarticulacies in the negotiation process caused delays in reaching an agreement.
meanings.sent5: The inarticulacies of the old radio broadcast added charm to its vintage appeal.
